2.text: I have often heard such things as these: you are all troublesome comforters.

3.text: Shall windy words have no end? or is it any trouble to thee to speak?

4.text: I also could speak like you: and would God your soul were for my soul. I would comfort you also with words, and would wag my head over you.

5.text: I would strengthen you with my mouth, and would move my lips, as sparing you.

6.text: But what shall I do? If I speak, my pain will not rest: and if I hold my peace, it will not depart from me.

7.text: But now my sorrow hath oppressed me, and all my limbs are brought to nothing.

8.text: My wrinkles bear witness against me, and a false speaker riseth up against my face, contradicting me.

9.text: He hath gathered together his fury against me, and threatening me he hath gnashed with his teeth upon me: my enemy hath beheld me with terrible eyes.

10.text: They have opened their mouths upon me, and reproaching me they have struck me on the cheek, they are filled with my pains.

11.text: God hath shut me up with the unjust man, and hath delivered me into the hands of the wicked.

12.text: I that was formerly so wealthy, am all on a sudden broken to pieces: he hath taken me by my neck, he hath broken me, and hath set me up to be his mark.

13.text: He hath compassed me round about with his lances, he hath wounded my loins, he hath not spared, and hath poured out my bowels on the earth.

14.text: He hath torn me with wound upon wound, he hath rushed in upon me like a giant.

15.text: I have sowed sackcloth upon my skin, and have covered my flesh with ashes.

16.text: My face is swollen with weeping, and my eyelids are dim.

17.text: These things have I suffered without the iniquity of my hand, when I offered pure prayers to God.

18.text: O earth, cover not thou my blood, neither let my cry find a hiding place in thee.

19.text: For behold my witness is in heaven, and he that knoweth my conscience is on high.

20.text: My friends are full of words: my eye poureth out tears to God.

21.text: And O that a man might so be judged with God, as the son of man is judged with his companion!

22.text: For behold short years pass away and I am walking in a path by which l shall not return.
